title: Maximum-minimums identity
text:
In <a href="mathematics">mathematics</a>, the maximum-minimums identity is a relation between the maximum element of a <a href="Set%20%28mathematics%29">set</a> "S" of "n" numbers and the minima of the 2"n" − 1 <a href="Empty%20set">non-empty</a> <a href="subset">subset</a>s of "S".
Let "S" = {"x"1, "x"2, ..., "x""n"}. The <a href="identity%20%28mathematics%29">identity</a> states that 
or conversely
For a probabilistic proof, see the reference.
